explanation: [0-0] This is a three-way split screen. The upper and lower parts show city night scenes with Spanish subtitles. In the middle part, there is a stage. On the left side of the stage stands a host wearing a dark blue suit, holding a microphone in his right hand and a card in his left hand, facing the right side. On the right side is a band. A man in a blue shirt and a cowboy hat is playing the accordion, with his left hand on the accordion and his head turned to the left. Behind him is a black platform with a drum set on it, where a man in a white shirt and a cowboy hat sits. There are also some lights.

[0-10] First, the host faces the right side with his legs open and squats slightly. The accordion player faces forward, lowers his head, pulls the accordion with his left hand and presses the keys with his right hand. The screen switches, and the accordion player turns his head to the left, looks at the host, and continues to play the accordion. The outline of a building drawn with red lines appears in the lower left corner of the middle part, and Spanish subtitles and "@zonadedesmadre" appear in the lower right corner. The city night scenes in the upper and lower parts keep changing, and a black, white and red logo with the words "Mike Salazar" and Spanish words keeps spinning in the lower part.
